meanings.sent1: The magician stonishes the audience with his incredible tricks.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected plot twist in the movie stonishes the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog stonishes everyone at the park.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting stonishes me like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset stonishes us every evening.

meanings.definition: To strike with awe or wonder.
meanings.sent1: The majestic waterfall stonishes visitors at the national park.
meanings.sent2: The grandeur of the cathedral stonishes all who enter.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten stonishes the big dog with its bravery.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors of the painting stonish the art critics.
meanings.sent5: The vastness of the universe stonishes astronomers and philosophers alike.

meanings.sent1: The speed of the cheetah stonishes researchers studying its movements.
meanings.sent2: The sudden appearance of a shooting star stonishes the children at the campfire.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise from the tiny toy stonishes the baby, making it giggle.
meanings.sent4: The generosity of the stranger stonishes the homeless man on the street.
meanings.sent5: The complexity of the human brain stonishes scientists exploring its mysteries.
